Review Title: Perfect size for a day trip
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 11, 2025
Review Content: Very nice quality, great value for the money!!!! Luxurious size for a personal cooler, super insulation. Great for a picnic, day trip, or the beach for a couple or small family. Love the sturdy handle; the top locks securely and holds a good-sized ice pack...No complaints! :)

Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 3, 2025
Review Content: We have used this product several times already and love its size and portability. It is made of durable material and cleans up easily. We love that the ice packs fit in the lid to allow for easy storage and more room within the cooler. The handle is sturdy and manages anything we pack inside.

Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 14, 2025
Review Content: One of the few coolers that are bit enough while still flat enough to fit in the back of a truck with the decked drawer system, at least for 2022 Ram 1500. Keeps things cool, and the ice packs are pretty neat. All in all, good product.

Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 5, 2026
Review Content: Right size to take anywhere no need for ice packs for a couple of hours transport, seals great no cold loss

Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 29, 2025
Review Content: I can hold over 6 bottles of beer. It's nice because it's tall enough to close the lid with bottles standing up.

Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on September 4, 2025
Review Content: Needed a short cooler that could fit under the seat of my tiny boat. Perfect size to fit, with a lithium battery right next to it in the back of the boat. Much better fit than the Yeti 20 I was using. About the cooler: It really does keep the ice. I read reviews saying that it doesn’t hold ice more than a couple hours. WRONG (at least for me). Started the trip around 10:00 AM and it still had a fair amount of frozen ice at 10:00 PM (all day in the boat, exposed to the sun portions of the day). And I only lined the top with ice, with a packed cooler full of drinks. There are other coolers that will hold ice longer (for at least three times the price & bulky). About the ice packs: They’re awesome. Like another reviewer stated, when frozen they can deform a little and not hold in place as well. However it’s temporary. When they thaw ever so slightly they fit tightly back in place. Quit wining people, its a great feature! They stayed locked in all day. Handle has some flex, but is sufficiently strong for the load you carry with it (just don’t pack any iron weights and you’ll be good).

Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 7, 2025
Review Content: Got a little hatchback, and leaving drinks in the back would be messy. Exploding in the summer, freezing in the winter. This was the ideal fix to store drinks in my car. Sturdy little thing with good insulation. Fits in my little Prius too.

Review Title: Dimensions were just what I needed
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 30, 2025
Review Content: This fit the bill. I am using to store temperature sensitive premixed dyes. I build custom insert racks. Be aware that the volume appears to be tapered lid to bottom. In other words, the lid area dimensions are longer/wider than the dimensions on the bottom. It's only a slight difference, but did cause me to shrink my insert size.

Review Content: Had an issue with the cooler but the vendor was great to deal with. I wish all vendors were that accomodating. Definitely give this cooler a try but remember to add an extra ice pack or ice if keeping for a long day in the warm/hot weather. I love its size.

Review Content: This is a very unusual size, and I've looked a long time to find this. It's perfect for carrying a pie or a salad in a bowl, as most small coolers don't have the depth for this. It has a couple of slots in the lid to insert the cold packs that come with it, and you can supplement with other cold packs on the bottom around the item. It has a good seal also, which is important. Couldn't be happier.

Review Title: Tough construction and ice lasted all day
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 3, 2023
Review Badge: Amazon Vine Customer Review of Free Product
Review Content: We took this on a outdoor all-day trip in 90 degree weather and it kept all our food and water cold. I love the 2 ice packs in the top that pop out and in easily to freeze and help keep everything cool. We loaded it up with ice and drinks and even with having it open a lot and replacing cold drinks with new warm ones, we still had a considerable amount of ice and freezing cold water at the end of the day. Closes tightly and has a sturdy handle for lifting even when at its fullest and heaviest.

Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 23, 2023
Review Badge: Amazon Vine Customer Review of Free Product
Review Content: This is a great one-handed cooler. I needed something I could carry with one hand and not those bulky two-handed or wheeled coolers. This was the perfect size for 2 people. I like the ice packs on top. I still put one on the bottom as well, but it's a nice design. Very happy.

Review Content: If you're carrying a human head or using it for a sous vide, this thing is perfect! I drilled a hole in the lid and used it for my sous vide. First cook was a 48 hour prime rib. It worked awesome!!!

Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 2, 2025
Review Content:
The real dimensions of the 10 Liter (11 Qt) blue cooler are:
Outside: 8.75w, 11.25L, 10.4h. Inside : 6.6 at bottom to 7.25 at top wide, 9.38b to 9.88t long, 8.95h.
Weight is 1140g (40.2 oz) w/o cool block, 1612g (56.9oz) with cool block.
the 8.75 width means it will not qualify as a personal item on an air plane.
The 8.95 interior height will not fit a milk jug (1/2 gal is 3.75x3.75x10h, 1 gal is 5.75x5.75x10h)
the 10.4 height is too low to sit on. (need 14")
If this cool box was 3/4" narrower, 3.5" higher, it would be really nice

Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on October 31, 2025
Review Content: I like it, but I think they should not have made the label so large and unwieldy, and it is hard to remove from the front

Review Title: Last of the low profile inventory

Review Content:

I wish this item was twice as large with the same low profile design.

Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 30, 2025
Review Content: Great low profile cooler but have not found to keep ice frozen. Perfect on SHORT boat trips. Did not keep inside insulated

Review Title: ice pack does not work as advertised
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 7, 2023
Review Content: Was initially excited about this tiny ice chest since it comes with a hard plastic ice pack that snaps into the inside lid. When it arrived the ice pack was snapped in place. When I removed the ice pack and froze it, it froze OK. Unfortunately, once the ice pack was frozen it would not & did not snap into place. All I can figure out is once frozen the pack swells and therefore the hole is too small. Since had to put ice in the chest it was too small for drinks, etc.

Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 13, 2026
Review Content: I assumed that this cooler would have a spray in insulation therefore making it a viable option to keep my food items cold. The first day I used it I found out that I was wrong. I did not keep my food items cold adequately. Not even close! Half of my ice was melted by noon. Just to note, I had a LOT of ice in the cooler. When I examined the cooler to gain an understanding of why this may have happened, I found that when I pushed in the sides on the outside it was flexible. If there had been foam sprayed in as I expected, then it would have not pushed in so easily. There may be foam inside; However, it is probably a sheet of foam which would not be nearly as effective as spray in foam. Very disappointed.

Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on September 7, 2025
Review Content:
There are three things I found wrong with this product.
-It is too hard to open. You have to fight with it each time you want to open it. The closure is too tight. Extremely annoying! I had to spend about 30 minutes with a knife and razor blade to file it down and slice away some plastic to make it easier to open.
-The walls are too thin and this cooler does not stay cold very long. If you want your food or drink to stay cold, you have to pack a good amount of gel packs or ice packs or else it won't stay cold for more than a couple of hours.
-The two cold packs that attach to the lid are very thin and do not stay cold very long. This was a bad purchase.

Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 26, 2025
Review Content: This cooler is worthless. The cold pack it comes with is also worthless. It freezes but doesn't keep anything cold. I used ice and blue cold packs that keep things in my large cooler cold for days, but not in this cooler. When you open it up when it has cold packs and ice in it it doesn't feel cool at all. Something about it just doesn't keep the coldness inside.
